div.head: Report:
div.p: Two crystals of potential TCR/pMHC complexes have been obtained in november 99 and have been tested for diffraction on ID14 eh3 beamline.

For one small crystal (0.2 x 0.08 x 0.01 mm), the data collection has been succesfull. The crystal was flash-cooled in the nitrogen gas stream, with PEG6000 as cryoprotectant. The crystal diffracts beyond 2.5 Å resolution. 180 images have been collected (∆φ: 1°, λ=0.93Å, exposure time : 90s) with the MarCCD detector. A complete data set has been obtained (Space group P2 1 2 1 2, a=77Å, b=120Å, c=103Å) with a Rmerge of 8.4% and a redundancy of 7.2.
The structure determination is still ongoing. The decay of diffraction was quite significant at the end of the data colection.

For the second crystal, slightly larger (0.2 x 0.15 x 0.02 mm) than the first one, the diffraction was quite poor. The resolution limit was around 7 Å. The crystal may have been damaged during the flash-freezing. No data have been collected.
